subject: Create skill error hierarchy
description:
Create the error hierarchy for the skills subsystem in `src/mamba_agents/skills/errors.py`.

Define the following exception classes:

- `SkillError(Exception)` — Base exception for all skill errors
- `SkillNotFoundError(SkillError)` — Skill path does not exist
- `SkillParseError(SkillError)` — Frontmatter YAML syntax error
- `SkillValidationError(SkillError)` — Frontmatter fields fail validation (include list of error messages)
- `SkillLoadError(SkillError)` — Permission denied or disk error during loading
- `SkillConflictError(SkillError)` — Duplicate skill names in same scope

Each exception should have a descriptive message and relevant context (skill name, path, etc.).

**Acceptance Criteria:**

_Functional:_
- [ ] All 6 error classes defined with proper inheritance chain
- [ ] Each error includes contextual attributes (name, path where applicable)
- [ ] Error messages are clear and actionable

_Edge Cases:_
- [ ] Errors are picklable (for multiprocessing compatibility)
- [ ] `repr()` and `str()` produce useful debugging info

_Error Handling:_
- [ ] Base `SkillError` is catchable for all skill-related errors

**Testing Requirements:**
• Unit: Each error class instantiation and message formatting
• Unit: Inheritance chain verification (isinstance checks)

Source: internal/specs/skills-and-subagents-SPEC.md Section 5.1-5.2
